question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you provide is executable for display. Design a rural courtyard with six bedrooms, two living rooms, and one kitchen, and draw it using HTML.

checklist.title: Is the rural courtyard layout completely implemented?
checklist.description: Verify whether the HTML code properly implements the required layout with six bedrooms, two living rooms, and one kitchen in a rural courtyard style. Score 0 if the core layout is missing elements, 5 if all required rooms are present but poorly arranged, and 10 if the layout is complete and logically arranged in a courtyard formation.

checklist.title: Is the architectural structure accurately represented?
checklist.description: Examine whether the courtyard design includes appropriate structural elements (walls, doors, windows, roofs) with correct proportions and rural characteristics. Deduct 3 points if structural elements are missing, 3 points if proportions are unrealistic, and 4 points if the rural style is not evident. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are the room relationships and connections logically designed?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the connections between rooms make architectural sense (e.g., bedrooms with proper privacy, kitchen accessible from living areas, logical doorways and pathways). Deduct 5 points for illogical room arrangements, 3 points for missing critical pathways, and 2 points for poor flow between spaces. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the courtyard component appropriately incorporated?
checklist.description: Check if the design includes a proper courtyard element that integrates well with the building structure in rural style. Deduct 5 points if the courtyard is missing or poorly defined, 3 points if it lacks rural characteristics, and 2 points if its relationship with surrounding rooms is poorly conceived. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle different screen sizes, browser compatibility issues, and ensures proper rendering across devices. Code with strong robustness should use responsive design principles and fallback options, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average with partial responsiveness, give 5 points, and if the design breaks on different screen sizes, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Interactive room exploration 2. Day/night lighting simulation 3. Rural-appropriate decorative elements). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant HTML elements or CSS styles that serve the same purpose 2. Excessive decorative elements that distract from the main layout 3. Fancy effects that affect loading performance. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core layout is interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review HTML structure (semantic HTML usage), CSS organization (systematic class naming, separation of concerns), and code maintainability. Deduct 5 points if non-semantic div-soup is prevalent; deduct 5 points if styles are inline rather than properly organized; deduct 5 points if the code lacks comments or organization. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching appropriate for a rural setting 2) Proper layout proportions reflecting architectural reality 3) Consistent visual style throughout the courtyard. Deduct 3 points for jarring visual elements, 5 points for unrealistic architectural representations, and 5 points for inconsistent visual styling. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the visual representation clear and intuitive?
checklist.description: Judge whether the visual representation clearly communicates the rural courtyard design: 1) Clear distinction between different room types 2) Intuitive understanding of the floor plan 3) Visual hierarchy that prioritizes important elements. Deduct 5 points for confusing room identification, 3 points for unclear boundaries between spaces, and 5 points for poor visual differentiation of architectural elements. The full score is 10 points.
